meanings.definition: Easily affected or hurt by something
meanings.sent1: She is very sensitive to loud noises.
meanings.sent2: His skin is sensitive to sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The sensitive plant closed its leaves when touched.
meanings.sent4: Her sensitive nature made her vulnerable to criticism.
meanings.sent5: The baby's sensitive ears picked up every sound in the room.

meanings.definition: Aware of and able to understand other people's feelings
meanings.sent1: He is a sensitive friend who always listens.
meanings.sent2: She has a sensitive heart and can empathize with others.
meanings.sent3: The sensitive counselor knew just what to say to comfort her.
meanings.sent4: His sensitive intuition helped him navigate social situations.
meanings.sent5: The sensitive artist captured the emotions of the painting perfectly.

meanings.definition: Quick to detect or respond to slight changes, signals, or influences
meanings.sent1: The sensitive instrument detected the smallest vibrations.
meanings.sent2: Her nose is sensitive to the faintest scents.
meanings.sent3: The sensitive alarm went off at the slightest movement.
meanings.sent4: His sensitive hearing allowed him to hear whispers from afar.
meanings.sent5: The sensitive thermometer showed the room's temperature accurately.
